segment.source: Avoid Lost Events
segment.target: Avoid Lost Events

segment.source: Avoid Lost Events
segment.target: Avoid Lost Events

segment.source: Avoid Lost Events
segment.target: Avoid Lost Events

segment.source: In Windows Performance Recorder (WPR), some applications generate so many events that Event Tracing for Windows (ETW) cannot keep up with the logging frequency.
segment.target: In Windows Performance Recorder (WPR), some applications generate so many events that Event Tracing for Windows (ETW) cannot keep up with the logging frequency.

segment.source: This problem manifests as lost events in the recordings.
segment.target: This problem manifests as lost events in the recordings.

segment.source: The problem can lead to analysis difficulties or erroneous conclusions because of incomplete data.
segment.target: The problem can lead to analysis difficulties or erroneous conclusions because of incomplete data.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: By default, WPR uses paged memory for buffers.
segment.target: By default, WPR uses paged memory for buffers.

segment.source: To set WPR to use non-paged memory for buffers, set the NonPagedMemory attribute to true for the provider.
segment.target: To set WPR to use non-paged memory for buffers, set the NonPagedMemory attribute to true for the provider.

segment.source: For more information about how to create a custom profile, see Authoring Recording Profiles and 2. System and Event Provider Definitions.
segment.target: For more information about how to create a custom profile, see Authoring Recording Profiles and 2. System and Event Provider Definitions.

segment.source: You can help prevent WPR from losing ETW buffers or events in the following ways:
segment.target: You can help prevent WPR from losing ETW buffers or events in the following ways:

segment.source: Use larger buffers to enable more efficient disk I/O when WPR writes the buffers to disk.
segment.target: Use larger buffers to enable more efficient disk I/O when WPR writes the buffers to disk.

segment.source: Count requests for the data collection the first time that you use a particular buffer configuration on a computer.
segment.target: Count requests for the data collection the first time that you use a particular buffer configuration on a computer.

segment.source: Use the command-line recordTempTo option to record to a different location than the default.
segment.target: Use the command-line recordTempTo option to record to a different location than the default.

segment.source: Increase the number of buffers.
segment.target: Increase the number of buffers.

segment.source: Simplify the scenario that you are testing, or select fewer profiles.
segment.target: Simplify the scenario that you are testing, or select fewer profiles.

segment.source: Free disk space on the system drive.
segment.target: Free disk space on the system drive.

segment.source: Use advanced hardware to collect the data; for example, use a disk subsystem that has higher throughput.
segment.target: Use advanced hardware to collect the data; for example, use a disk subsystem that has higher throughput.

segment.source: This is the last option to consider.
segment.target: This is the last option to consider.

segment.source: You can usually avoid losing events by carefully selecting the providers to enable and the buffers to use.
segment.target: You can usually avoid losing events by carefully selecting the providers to enable and the buffers to use.
